text:
It would be great if every project every written had a 
database of error messages combined with a common reasons 
why those messages occur, and common fixes.

Toward that end, log4j can support other programs like 
faq-o-matic's, by supplying a list of log messages that 
programmer's embed into the source code and print via log4j.  

For example, one might run 

grep_log4j_messages src/

     "XYZ file not found"
     "invalid ABC configuration"
     "missing 123 component"

then push these messages into a faq-o-matic
creator: pklein@lehman.com
pklein@lehman.com
text:
I just wanted to add that I got the idea for this suggestion 
while trying to look up a cvs error message.  When I never found 
a decent explanation of the error message, I thought of a faq of 
error messages, and submitted this idea not to CVS, but to the 
subversion project:

http://subversion.tigris.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=1278

apparently they like the idea, and would thus be greatly help in 
implementing it if LOG4J were to provide a 'log message grepping 
source analyzer'

Bloat.  Do it yourself on SourceForge if you feel like it, and when it matures 
and gathers an active community resubmit it as a Logging Services subproject.
creator: yoavs@computer.org
